p: (2) Measurement of Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE) Activity in the Prolonged Diuretic Activity. For ACE activity, rats were separated into four groups ( n = 5) and treated with AS-AT (30, 100, and 300 mg/kg) and captopril (60 mg/kg). Briefly, after seven days of treatment, blood was collected from overnight fasting treated animals and centrifuged, and serum was separated. Serum (10 μL) was mixed with assay solution (490 μL) and incubated for 15 min at 37°C. Then 1.2 mL of NaOH was added to halt the reaction followed by the addition of 100 μL of o-phthaldialdehyde. Finally, the formation of His-Leu in the reaction mixture was analyzed fluorometrically in triplicate to measure ACE activity.
